p: Herbal medicines can play a major role in developing sustainable integrative practices using local herbs to boost the immune system and reduce the effects of inflammatory diseases. However, many herbal medicines are never tested in randomized controlled trials due to lack of financial resources. Baars et al. therefore argue for the use of expert knowledge to provide a lower level of evidence for using IM methods to treat infectious diseases. The authors show that 2 of the 9 most prescribed anthroposophic treatments (Hustenelixer and Echinacea) and 3 of 10 most prescribed homeopathic treatments (Belladonna, Hepar sulphuris, Mercurius solubilis) used for cough and sour throat have been studies in clinical trials (Baars et al. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.eujim.2020.101194).
